I dont believe it is all social constructions, but as a social species a lot of it is. 
[/bq]
I'll give you that.

People who suffer from brain injuries that destroy pre-frontal lobes or people that have been lobotomised still can breath and such, but can hardly do anything else.

I'd have to say 95% cause without pre-frontal lobes people can breath and have bowel control, but not much else.

Society, in my eyes, largely reinforces these instincts in a constructive way.

But if put in a bizarre environment with no social contact and you've basically just fucked up that person.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54894c746368720a6f840400#post_54894c746368720a6f840400
i don't know

actually that's a lie

[spoiler]i used to go on one particular forum a few people i met online made, and we hung out there everyday, for like years

at some point i got super annoying and honestly creepy, i don't know what the hell was with me
i eventually stopped, after a couple people got mad at me consistently

but after that i got super self deprecating, and it was quite obvious
like to the point where, i assumed i was just annoying people, even though no one said i was
and again, even though no said it, i was assuming that everyone just hated me

i don't talk with those people much anymore, i'm still friends with most of them, but i still worry about what people think of me[/spoiler]
topics.author: 4fe3df367f123b517900066a

I always ask if people are OK with me...and they always say yes...I guess It is I who am not okay with myself.
